source_sentence: （四〇）◎貧人以麨團施現獲報緣
translation: (40) - A poor person's present reward for giving with a morsel of bread

source_sentence: 昔有一人，居家貧窮，為人肆力，得麨六升，齎持歸家，養育妻息。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a man who lived in poverty and worked hard for someone to get six liters of bread to carry home to support his wife and children.

source_sentence: 會於中路，見一道人，執鉢捉錫，行求乞食，即生心念：「彼沙門者，形貌端政，威儀庠序，甚可恭敬，得施一食，不亦快乎？」
translation: When he met in the middle of the road and saw a man carrying a bowl and a tin, begging for food, he thought, "That ascetic is well-balanced, well-groomed, well-behaved, and very respectable; wouldn't it be nice to give him a meal?"

source_sentence: 爾時道人，知其心念，隨逐貧人，至一水邊，貧人即便語道人言：「我今有麨，意欲相施，頗能食不？」
translation: Then, knowing his thoughts, the religious man followed the poor man to a place near water, and even then the poor man said to the religious man, "Now, I have some bread that I'd like to give, but will you eat it?"

source_sentence: 道人答言：「唯得而已。」
translation: The Daoist replied, "Only attained."

source_sentence: 即於水邊，為其敷衣，令道人坐，和一升麨，用為一團，而以與之，作是念言：「若此道人，是淨持戒得道人，使我現作一小國王。」
translation: He then spread out his robes by the water's edge, made the Daoist sit, mixed a liter of bread into a ball, and gave it to him, thinking, "If this is a Daoist who has attained the path of pure observance of precepts, it would make me a small king."

source_sentence: 道人得麨，語貧人言：「何以極少？
translation: When the Daoist obtains the bread, he says to the poor man, "Why is it so little?

source_sentence: 何以極小？」
translation: How could it be so very small?"

source_sentence: 此人謂此道人大食，復和一升，用作一團，與而願言：「若此道人，是淨持戒得道之人，使我得作二小國王。」
translation: That man said that this Daoist had given him a large meal, so he mixed another liter and made it into a ball, then gave it to him and vowed, "If this Daoist is a pure adherent of morality who has attained the way, then I'll be made king of two small countries."

source_sentence: 道人復言：「何以極少？
translation: The Daoist then replied, "Why is it so little?

source_sentence: 何以極小？」
translation: How could it be so very small?"

source_sentence: 貧人念言：「唯是道人，極似多食，與如許麨，猶嫌少小，然我已請，事須供給。」
translation: The poor man thought, "Only this man of the Way seems to have eaten a lot, and this amount of bread is still too small for him.

source_sentence: 復和二升麨，用為一團，而以與之，又作念言：「若此道人，是淨持戒得道人者，使我現得領四小國王。」
translation: He then made up two liters of flour, used it to make a ball, and gave it to him. Again, he thought, "If this man of the Way were someone who has attained the Way by keeping the precepts pure, I would now be able to lead four small kingdoms."

source_sentence: 道人復言：「何以極少？
translation: The Daoist then said, "Why is it so little?

source_sentence: 何以極小？」
translation: How could it be so very small?"

source_sentence: 餘有二升，盡和作團，以與道人，又作願言：「今此道人，若是清淨持戒人者，使我得作波羅[木*奈]國王，領四小國，獲見諦道。」
translation: He mixed the remaining two liters into a ball and gave it to the religious practitioner, making the vow, "Now, if this religious practitioner is a pure observer of the precepts, it will enable me to become the king of the state of Para [munai] and lead four small states to see the true path."

source_sentence: 道人得麨，故嫌少小。
translation: The man of the Way has obtained enough flour to dislike the small amount.

source_sentence: 貧人白言：「唯願且食，若不足者，當脫衣裳，貿取飲食，共相供給。」
translation: The poor man said, "Please eat it, for if it's not enough, you must take off your clothes and gather food and drink to share with each other."

source_sentence: 道人即食，唯盡一升，餘還歸主。
translation: The native then ate, but he only took the whole litre and returned the rest to his master.

source_sentence: 貧人問言：「尊者先嫌麨極少小，如今云何食不令盡？」
translation: The poor man asked, "Venerable, you first thought the amount of bread was too small.

source_sentence: 道人答言：「汝初與我一團麨時，正求作一小國王故，是以我言：『汝心願少。』
translation: The monk replied, "When you first gave me a morsel of bread, you were seeking to be the king of a small kingdom, so I said, 'Your heart's desire is small.'

source_sentence: 第二團麨，正願得作二小國王，是以我言：『汝願少小。』
translation: The second morsel of flour was intended to make you king of two small states, and so I said, 'Your wish is small.'

source_sentence: 第三團麨，正求得作四小國王，是以我言：『汝心願小。』
translation: The third morsel of flour was intended to be made into four minor kings, and I said, 'Your wish is small.'

source_sentence: 第四團麨，正求作波羅[木*奈]國王，領四小國，使我後得見諦道果，是以我言：『汝願少小。』
translation: The fourth morsel of flour was seeking to become the king of Prāgbodhi and lead four small states, so that I might later attain the fruit of the path of seeing reality, and so I said, 'Your wish is small.'

source_sentence: 不以不足而慊少小。」
translation: Don't be dissatisfied with being small because you're not enough."

source_sentence: 爾時貧人，自生疑念：「使我現得王五國者，此事不小，恐無實耳。」
translation: It was then that the poor man himself had this doubt, "Suppose I were to attain the kingship of five countries right now, for this would be no small thing, but I'm afraid it's not true."

source_sentence: 又復思惟：「能知我心，必是聖人，是大福田，不應誑我。」
translation: Again, he thought, "That person who knows my mind must be a sage, a field of great merit, and shouldn't deceive me."

source_sentence: 道人知已，即擲其鉢，著虛空中，隨後飛去，化作大身，滿於虛空；又化作小，猶如微塵。
translation: After he knew this, the man of the Way threw his bowl into the sky and flew away, transforming it into a large body that filled the sky and into a small one that was like a tiny particle of dust.

source_sentence: 以一身作無量身，以無量身合為一身，身上出水，身下出火，履水如地，履地如水，作十八變，語貧人言：「好發大願，莫有疑慮。」
translation: He takes one body and makes it formless, combines formless into one body, produces water on his body and fire underneath it, treads water like the ground, treads ground like water, and creates 18 transformations. He says to the poor man, "Make a great vow, and don't have any doubts."

source_sentence: 即隱身去。
translation: He then withdrew and departed.

source_sentence: 時此貧人，向波羅[木*奈]城，而於道中，見一輔相。
translation: The poor man then traveled to the city of [Mokṣala] and saw an auxiliary figure in the path.

source_sentence: 輔相見已，諦視形相，而語之言：「汝非某甲子耶？」
translation: When the auxiliary man saw him, he looked closely at his features and said, "Aren't you a certain son of Kālāmas?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我是。」
translation: They replied, "I am."

source_sentence: 問言：「何以襤褸乃至爾也？」
translation: He asked, "What is the reason for this, the patchwork coat or even this?"

source_sentence: 答言：「少失恃怙，居家喪盡，無人見看，是以困苦，襤褸如此。」
translation: He replied, "He lost his father and mother when he was young, lost his home, and had no one to look at him; as a result, he's in distress and in a ragged coat."

source_sentence: 輔相即啟波羅[木*奈]王：「王之所親某甲之子，今在門外，極為窮悴。」
translation: The auxiliary minister then revealed to King Pārāṇasī, "The son of a certain man who's close to the king is now outside the gate, extremely poor and exhausted."

source_sentence: 王尋有勅：「令使將前。」
translation: The king then had a command, "Order the messenger to come forward."

source_sentence: 問其委曲，知是所親，王即告言：「好親近我，慎莫遠離。」
translation: He asked him about his complaints and knew he was related to him. The king then told him, "Be close to me, and don't stray far from me."

source_sentence: 却後七日，王病命終，諸臣謀言：「王無繼嗣，唯此窮子，是王所親，宜共推舉作波羅[木*奈]王。」
translation: When the king's illness ended seven days after his death, the ministers conspired, saying, "The king has no heir; this poor son is the only one he's close to, so we should elect him king of [Mokṣala]."

source_sentence: 統領四國，然後虐暴。
translation: They ruled the four kingdoms and then committed violence.

source_sentence: 先彼道人，於虛空中，當王殿前，結加趺坐，而語之言：「汝昔發願，求得見諦。
translation: Earlier, that man of the Way sat cross-legged in the sky in front of the king's palace and said, "In the past, you made a vow to see the truth.

source_sentence: 今日云何乃造眾惡，與本乖違？」
translation: Today, why have you done so many evils that are at odds with the origin?"

source_sentence: 又復為王說種種法。
translation: He also explained various teachings to the king.

source_sentence: 王聞法已，悔先作惡，改過慚愧，精專行道，得須陀洹。
translation: After hearing the teaching, the king repented of his prior misdeeds, changed his ways and became conscience, concentrated on his practice, and attained stream entry.

source_sentence: （四一）貧女以兩錢布施即獲報緣
translation: (41) A poor woman who gave two coins as alms received immediate rewards.

source_sentence: 昔晝闇山中，多諸賢聖隱居眾僧。
translation: Once upon a time, there were many good men and sages living in seclusion as monks on the Dark Mountain.

source_sentence: 諸方國土，聞彼山名，供養者眾。
translation: Many lands in various directions heard of that mountain's name and made offerings to it.

source_sentence: 有一長者，將諸眷屬，往送供養。
translation: There was an elderly man who sent his retinue to make offerings to him.

source_sentence: 有一貧窮乞索女人，作是念言：「今諸長者，送供詣山，必欲作會，我當往乞。」
translation: A poor beggar woman had this thought, "Now, these elders who have sent offerings to the mountain must want to make an assembly, so I'll go begging."

source_sentence: 便向山中。
translation: She then headed for the mountain.

source_sentence: 既到山已，見向長者，設種種饌，供養眾僧，私自思惟：「彼人先世修福，今日富貴，今復重作功德將勝；我先世不作，今世貧苦，今若不作，未來轉劇。」
translation: When she arrived on the mountain, she saw the elders who were making offerings to the saṃgha and thought to herself, "That person cultivated merit in a previous life and became wealthy today; if I do it again now, my virtue will be greater; I didn't do it in a previous life and I've been poor in the present life; if I don't do it now, it will be worse in the future."

source_sentence: 思惟此已，啼哭不樂，又自念言：「我曾糞中，拾得兩錢，恒常寶惜，以俟乞索不如意時，當貿飲食用自存活。
translation: After thinking about this, he lamented and became unhappy, then thought to himself, "I once found two coins in a garbage dump and always treasured them until I begged for something less than what I wanted, then I would drink and eat them to survive on my own.

source_sentence: 今當持以布施眾僧，分一二日不得飲食，終不能死。」
translation: Now, I will take it and give it to the saṃgha. If I don't get something to eat for a day or two, I won't be able to die."

source_sentence: 伺僧食訖，捉此兩錢即便布施。
translation: After waiting for the saṃgha to finish eating, he took these two coins and gave them away.

source_sentence: 彼山僧法，人有施者，維那僧前立為呪願。
translation: According to the saṃgha's teaching on that mountain, if someone gives to the saṃgha, Vairocana will make a vow in front of the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 當於爾時，上座不聽維那呪願，自為呪願。
translation: At the time, the elder monk didn't listen to Venerable's invocation and made his own invocation.

source_sentence: 諸下坐等，深生慊心，而作此念：「得彼乞女兩枚小錢，上座自輕，為其呪願，如常見錢，何以不爾？」
translation: The people sitting down had a profound feeling of dissatisfaction and thought, "Why wouldn't it be like that beggar woman who got two small coins, for whom the patron himself despised and whose curse he vowed, to see the coins as usual?"

source_sentence: 上座尋時，留半分食，與此女人。
translation: When the ascended master looked for her, he left half of his food and gave it to this woman.

source_sentence: 諸人見上座多與，人人多與。
translation: When the people saw how much the ascended seat gave, everyone gave more.

source_sentence: 此女時得重擔飲食，極大歡喜：「我適布施，今以得報。」
translation: The woman then received a heavy burden of food and drink and rejoiced greatly, "I was right to give alms, and now I've been rewarded."

source_sentence: 即擔飲食還出山去，到一樹下，眠臥止息。
translation: She then returned with a burden of food and drink and went back out of the mountain to sleep and rest under a tree.

source_sentence: 會值王大夫人亡來七日，王遣使者，按行國界，誰有福德？
translation: When the king's mistress died seven days later, the king sent an envoy to visit the kingdom's border, asking who had merit.

source_sentence: 應為夫人。
translation: She should be a wife.

source_sentence: 相師占言此黃雲蓋下，必有賢人。
translation: The fortune teller told him, "Under this yellow cloud, there must be a good man.

source_sentence: 即共相將，至彼樹下。
translation: They then joined forces and went under that tree.

source_sentence: 見彼女人，顏色潤澤，有福德相，樹為曲蔭，光影不移，相師言：「此女人福德，堪為夫人。」
translation: Seeing that woman, whose color was lustrous and her features were fortunate, and whose tree was shaded by a curved canopy of light and shadow that didn't shift, the fortune teller said, "This woman's fortune makes her a worthy wife."

source_sentence: 即以香湯沐浴，與夫人衣服，不大不小與身相稱，千乘萬騎，左右導從，將來至宮。
translation: He then bathed her in scented bathwater, put on her robes, matched her body size with his, and led her to the palace with a thousand carts and ten thousand horses, right and left.

source_sentence: 王見歡喜，心生敬重，如是數時，私自念言：「我所以得是富福緣，以施錢故。
translation: The king was delighted by what he saw, and his heart was filled with respect. When he did so, he privately thought, "This is the reason I got this wealth and merit, because I gave money.

source_sentence: 今彼眾僧，便為於我有大重恩。」
translation: Now, those monks have shown me great kindness."

source_sentence: 即白王言：「我先斯賤，王見拔擢，得為人次，聽我報彼眾僧之恩。」
translation: He then said to the king, "I was so lowly in the past that the king saw fit to promote me to a higher rank, so allow me to repay the kindness of those monks."

source_sentence: 王言：「隨意。」
translation: The king said, "As you wish."

source_sentence: 夫人即時，車載飲食及以珍寶，往到彼山施僧食訖，以寶布施。
translation: Immediately, the lady drove up to that mountain with food and drink and treasures and gave the monks a meal and a gift of treasure.

source_sentence: 上座不起，遣維那呪願，不自呪願。
translation: She got up from her seat and sent Vina to perform a vow, not a vow of her own.

source_sentence: 王夫人言：「我昔兩錢，為我呪願；今車載珍寶，不為我呪願？」
translation: The king's wife said, "I used to have a vow for two coins, but now I have a vow for a chariot full of treasures, and you don't have a vow for me?"

source_sentence: 諸年少比丘，皆慊上坐，先貧女人，以兩錢布施，為其呪願，今王夫人，車載珍寶，不為呪願，為老耄耶？
translation: Are those young monks sitting up there in disagreement, when a poor woman first gave two coins as an offering and vowed for them, but now the king's wife, with her chariot full of treasures, doesn't vow for that, but is she an old woman?

source_sentence: 爾時上座，即為王夫人，演說正法語言：「夫人！
translation: The ascended seat then addressed the king's wife, explaining the correct teaching in words, "My lady!

source_sentence: 心念慊我：『先以兩錢施時，為我呪願，今車載珍寶，不為呪願。』
translation: He was mindful and dissatisfied with me, 'When I first gave two coins, I had a curse vowed for me, but now I'm carrying a chariot full of treasures, so I don't have a curse vow.'

source_sentence: 我佛法中，不貴珍寶，唯貴善心。
translation: In my Buddhist teaching, treasures aren't valued, but only good intentions.

source_sentence: 夫人！
translation: Madam!

source_sentence: 先施兩錢之時，善心極勝，後施珍寶，吾我貢高，是以我今不與呪願。
translation: When I first gave two coins, my good intentions were overwhelming; when I later gave treasures, my pride was high; therefore, I won't grant the vow.

source_sentence: 年少道人！
translation: Young man of the Way!

source_sentence: 亦莫慊我，汝當深解出家之心。」
translation: Don't be discontented with me; you must deeply understand the intention to leave home."

source_sentence: 諸年少道人，各自慚愧，皆得須陀洹道。
translation: The young religious men, each ashamed, attained the path of stream entry.

source_sentence: 王夫人聽法，慚愧歡喜，亦得須陀洹道。
translation: The king's wife listened to the teaching, rejoiced in shame, and also attained the stream entry path.

source_sentence: 聽法已訖，作禮而去。
translation: After listening to the teaching, she made obeisance and departed.

source_sentence: （四二）◎乾陀衛國畫師罽那設食獲報緣
translation: (42) Śākyamuni's painter Kaina set out to obtain a meal as a reward

source_sentence: 昔乾陀衛國，有一畫師，名曰罽那，三年客作，得三十兩金，欲還歸家，而見他作般遮于瑟，問維那言：「一日作會，可用幾許？」
translation: Once there was a painter named Kaina in Qandhavai who had been a customer for three years and had received thirty taels of gold. He wanted to return home, but when he saw him making a banner for his serge, he asked Vina, "How much can I use for a day's work?"

source_sentence: 維那答言：「用三十兩金，得一日會。」
translation: Vairocana replied, "For thirty taels of gold, I'll get a one-day meeting."

source_sentence: 即自念言：「由我先身不種福業故受此報，傭力自活，今遭福田，云何不作？」
translation: He then thought to himself, "I received this reward because I didn't plant meritorious karma in my prior life; I helped myself to a living, and now I've been saddled with a field of merit.

source_sentence: 即語維那：「請為弟子，鳴椎集僧，我欲設會。」
translation: He then said to Vairocana, "Please be my disciple and assemble the saṃgha with wooden sticks, for I want to set up an assembly."

source_sentence: 設會已訖，踊躍歡喜，即便歸家。
translation: After setting up the assembly, he rejoiced and rallied, and returned home.

source_sentence: 既到家已，其婦問言：「三年客作，錢財所在？」
translation: When he arrived home, his wife asked, "Where's the money and property from your three-year guest engagement?"

source_sentence: 其夫答言：「我所得財，今已舉著堅牢藏中。」
translation: The husband replied, "Now, I've put my wealth in a storeroom that's sturdy."

source_sentence: 婦時問言：「堅牢之藏，今在何許？」
translation: The woman then asked, "Where is the storeroom of the strong prison now?"

source_sentence: 夫言：「乃在僧中。」
translation: The husband said, "He's here among the saṃgha."

source_sentence: 婦時慊責，即集親里，縛其夫主，詣斷事人，而作是言：「我之母子，貧窮辛苦，無衣無食，而我夫主，得財餘用，不擔來歸，請詰所以。」
translation: Disconcerted, the woman gathered her relatives, bound her husband and mother, and went to the orderly and said, "My mother and son are poor and hard-pressed, with no clothing or food, yet my husband and mother have money and provisions to spare, and he didn't bother to come home.

source_sentence: 時斷事人，問其夫言：「何以爾也？」
translation: The person in charge of the business then asked the husband, "Why is that?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我身如電光不久照曜，亦如朝露須臾則滅，由是恐懼，深自念言：『緣我前身不作福業，今遭窮苦，衣食困乏。』
translation: He replied, "My body is like a flash of lightning that doesn't shine for a long time, and it's like morning dew that goes out in a moment. Because of this fear, I deeply thought to myself, 'It's because I didn't do any good deeds in the past that I'm now in poverty and have little food and clothing.'

source_sentence: 故因見彼弗迦羅城中，作般遮會，眾僧清淨，心生歡喜，敬信內發，即問維那：『得幾許物，供一日食？』
translation: Therefore, when he saw the assembly of monks in Pukkusāti and the purity of the saṃgha, his heart rejoiced and his inner faith was aroused, so he asked Vairocana, 'How much could I get to feed myself for one day?'

source_sentence: 維那答言：『得三十兩金，可得供一日。』
translation: Vairocana replied, 'I'll get thirty taels of gold to feed the monks for one day.'

source_sentence: 我三年中，作所得物，即與維那，使為眾僧作一日食。」
translation: What I've gained in three years will be given to Vairocana to feed the saṃgha for one day."

source_sentence: 時斷事人，聞是語已，心生歡喜，憐愍其人，脫己衣服瓔珞及以鞍馬并諸乘具，悉施罽那，即分一村落而賞封之。
translation: After hearing those words, the handler rejoiced, took pity on that man, took off his clothing and jewelry, put on his saddle and horse, and gave it all to Kaina, and then he divided it into villages and gave it to him as a reward.

source_sentence: 華報如此，其果在後。
translation: Thus was the reward of flowers, and its fruit was to follow.

source_sentence: （四三）◎罽夷羅夫婦自賣設會現獲報緣
translation: (43) â€œKhajira and his wife sold themselves into a meeting and now reaped the rewards.â

source_sentence: 昔有一人，名罽夷羅，夫婦二人，貧窮理極，傭賃自活。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a man named Kajira, a husband and wife who were both extremely poor and living on a rented basis.

source_sentence: 見他長者悉往寺中，作大施會，來歸家中，共婦止宿，頭枕婦臂，自思惟言：「由我前身不作福故，今日貧窮。
translation: He saw all the other elders go to the temple, give a great almsgiving, return home, sleep with the wife, and lay their heads on her arm as they thought to themselves, "It's because I didn't do anything good in the past that I'm poor today.

source_sentence: 如彼長者，先身作福，今亦作福；我今無福，將來之世，唯轉苦劇。」
translation: Just like that old man who did make merit in his prior life, he's also making merit now; without merit now, I'll only experience suffering in a future life."

source_sentence: 作是念已，涕泣不樂，淚墮婦臂。
translation: After that thought, he wept and was unhappy, and his tears fell onto the woman's arm.

source_sentence: 婦問夫言：「何以落淚？」
translation: The woman asked her husband, "Why are the tears falling?"

source_sentence: 答言：「見他修福常得快樂，自鄙貧賤，無以修福，是以落淚。」
translation: They replied, "They see others cultivating virtue and always attaining happiness, but they despise themselves as poor and have no way to cultivate virtue, which is why they shed tears."

source_sentence: 婦言：「落淚何益？
translation: The woman said, "What good will she get from shedding tears?

source_sentence: 可以我身賣與他人取財作福。」
translation: I could sell my body to another person to obtain property for their own benefit."

source_sentence: 夫言：「若當相賣，我身如何得自存活？」
translation: The man said, "If we were to sell each other, how could my body survive on its own?"

source_sentence: 婦言：「若恐不活不見出者，我今與君俱共自賣，而修功德。」
translation: The woman said, "If I'm afraid I won't live and see no one leave, I'll sell myself and you together to cultivate virtue."

source_sentence: 於是夫婦，便共相將，至一富家，而語之言：「今我夫婦，以此賤身，請貿金錢。」
translation: So the couple went together to a rich family and said, "Now, this is a cheap body of mine and mine, and we'd like to buy some money."

source_sentence: 主人問言：「欲得幾錢？」
translation: The owner asked, "How much money do you want?"

source_sentence: 答言：「欲得十金錢。」
translation: He replied, "I want to earn ten coins."

source_sentence: 主人言：「今與汝錢，却後七日，不得償我，以汝夫婦，即為奴婢。」
translation: The master said, "Now, I'll give you the money, but if you don't pay me back within seven days afterward, your husband and wife will be my slaves and servants."

source_sentence: 言契以定，齎錢往詣，至彼塔寺，施設作會。
translation: He agreed, took the money, went to the stūpa, and set up a meeting there.

source_sentence: 夫婦二人，自共搗米，相勸勵言：「今日我等得自出力而造福業，後屬他家，豈從意也？」
translation: The husband and wife pounded rice together and encouraged each other, saying, "Today, we've contributed our own efforts to create a good deed; would we have wanted to belong to another family later?"

source_sentence: 於是晝夜，懃辦會具，到六日頭，垂欲作會，值彼國主亦欲作會，來共諍日，眾僧皆言：「以受窮者，終不得移。」
translation: During the day and night, he prepared the preparations for the assembly, and when he arrived at the end of the sixth day and was about to make the assembly, the lord of the kingdom also wanted to make the assembly and came to debate the day together, and the monks all said, "Because I'm poor, I'll never be able to move."

source_sentence: 國主聞已，作是言曰：「彼何小人，敢能與我共諍會日？」
translation: When the lord heard this, he said, "What kind of little man would dare to spend a day of disputation with me?"

source_sentence: 即遣人語罽羅：「汝避我日。」
translation: He then sent someone to Kālā, saying, "You avoided me for days."

source_sentence: 罽羅答言：「實不相避。」
translation: Kala replied, "It's true that you don't avoid each other."

source_sentence: 如是三反，執辭如初。
translation: He did so three times and continued to insist on the same answer as before.

source_sentence: 王怪所以，自至僧坊，語彼人言：「汝今何以不後日作，共我諍日？」
translation: The king wondered why, so he went to the monastery and told the man, "Why aren't you working later in the day and disputing my day with me?"

source_sentence: 答言：「唯一日自在，後屬他家，不復得作。」
translation: He replied, "Only one day is at ease, and then it belongs to another family; it's no longer possible to do so."

source_sentence: 王即問言：「何以不得？」
translation: The king then asked, "Why isn't it possible?"

source_sentence: 自賣者言：「自惟先身不作福業，今日窮苦，今若不作，恐後轉苦。
translation: The person who sells himself says, "I thought I hadn't done meritorious work in my previous life, and now I'm poor and suffering, and if I don't do it now, I'm afraid I'll become more miserable later.

source_sentence: 感念此事，唯自賣身，以貿金錢，用作功德，欲斷此苦。
translation: Being mindful of this, he simply sells himself and uses the gold he sells to make merit, hoping to end this suffering.

source_sentence: 至七日後，無財償他，即作奴婢。
translation: If I don't have the money to repay others after seven days, I'll become a slave.

source_sentence: 今以六日，明日便滿，以是之故，分死諍日。」
translation: Now, it's been six days, and tomorrow it will be up; for this reason, I'll share the days of death and debate."

source_sentence: 王聞是語，深生憐愍，歎未曾有：「汝真解悟貧窮之苦，能以不堅之身，易於堅身，不堅之財，易於堅財，不堅之命，易於堅命。」
translation: Hearing these words, the king took pity on them and praised them as unprecedented, "You truly understand the suffering of poverty and can take a body that's not hard and make it hard, a fortune that's not hard and make it hard, and a life that's not hard and make it hard."

source_sentence: 即聽設會，王以己身并及夫人衣服瓔珞，脫與罽羅夫婦，割十聚落，與作福封。
translation: After listening to the assembly, the king took his own body, his wife's clothing and jewelry, and handed them over to the Kālāma couple, cutting off ten villages and making them seals of merit.

source_sentence: 夫能至心，修福德者，現得華報，猶尚如是，況其將來獲果報也。
translation: It's still like this for someone who can wholeheartedly cultivate merit and obtain the rewards of flowers now, so why wouldn't they obtain the rewards of fruits in the future?

source_sentence: 由此觀之，一切世人，欲得免苦，當懃修福，何足縱情懈怠放逸？
translation: From this observation, all people who want to be spared suffering should strive to cultivate merit, so why should they be so lazy and careless as to indulge in it?

source_sentence: （四四）◎沙彌救蟻子水災得長命報緣
translation: (4) Śrāmaṇer's rescue of an ant from flooding and obtaining the conditions for a long life

source_sentence: 昔者有一羅漢道人，畜一沙彌，知此沙彌却後七日必當命終，與假歸家，至七日頭，勅使還來。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a certain arhat religious practitioner who had an śrāmaṇer in his custody and knew that seven days after his departure, he would surely die, so he gave him leave to go home, and when seven days had passed, I ordered him to return.

source_sentence: 沙彌辭師，即便歸去，於其道中，見眾蟻子，隨水漂流，命將欲絕，生慈悲心，自脫袈裟，盛土堰水，而取蟻子，置高燥處，遂悉得活。
translation: When he left his master and returned home, he saw many ants floating in the water in his path, about to lose their lives.

source_sentence: 至七日頭，還歸師所。
translation: He returned to the master's quarters seven days later.

source_sentence: 師甚怪之，尋即入定，以天眼觀，知其更無餘福得爾，以救蟻子因緣之故，七日不死，得延命長。
translation: The teacher was surprised, but he immediately went into meditation and observed with his divine eye, knowing that he had no more merit to attain, and that because of the cause and conditions of saving the ants' seeds, he didn't die for seven days and was able to prolong his life.

source_sentence: （四五）◎乾陀衛國王治故塔寺得延命緣
translation: (45) - The king of Qandawei ruled the old stūpa and attained the condition of prolonged life.

source_sentence: 昔乾陀衛國，有一國主，有一明相師，占王，却後七日，必當命終。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a lord of Qandawei who had a master of divination who divined that the king's life would surely end seven days after he left.

source_sentence: 出遊獵行，見一故塔，毀敗崩壞，即令群臣共修治之，修治已訖，歡喜還宮，七日安隱。
translation: When he went out on a hunting trip and saw an old stūpa that had fallen into disrepair, he had his ministers repair it together.

source_sentence: 相師見過七日，怪其所以，問王言：「作何功德？」
translation: When the fortune teller saw the seventh day, he wondered why and asked the king, "What merit did he achieve?"

source_sentence: 答言：「更無所作，唯有一破塔，以埿補治。」
translation: He replied, "There's nothing left to do but to repair a broken stūpa with water."

source_sentence: 由治塔故，功德如是。
translation: This is the merit of patching the stūpa.

source_sentence: （四六）比丘補寺壁孔獲延命報緣
translation: (46) A monk who patches a hole in a temple wall obtains the reward of prolonged life.

source_sentence: 昔有比丘，死時將至，會有外道婆羅門見，相是比丘，知七日後必當命終。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a monk who was approaching the time of his death and was met by a layman Brāhmaṇa who saw this monk and knew that he would surely die seven days later.

source_sentence: 時此比丘，因入僧坊，見壁有孔，即便團泥，而補塞之。
translation: That monk then went into the monastery and saw a hole in the wall, so he packed mud and patched it up.

source_sentence: 緣此福故，增其壽命，得過七日。
translation: Because of this merit, his life expectancy was increased, and he was able to live longer than seven days.

source_sentence: 婆羅門見，怪其所以，而問之言：「汝修何福？」
translation: When the Brāhmaṇa saw this, he wondered why and asked, "What merit are you cultivating?"

source_sentence: 比丘答言：「我無所修，唯於昨日，入僧房中，見壁有孔，補治而已。」
translation: The monk replied, "There's nothing I've cultivated except that yesterday I went into the saṃgha's room and saw a hole in the wall, so I just fixed it."

source_sentence: 婆羅門歎言：「是僧福田，最為深重，能使應死比丘續命延壽。」
translation: The brāhmaṇa praised him, saying, "This is the monk's field of merit, which is most profound and can give a monk who should die a renewed lease on life and a longer life."

source_sentence: （四七）◎長者子見佛求長命緣
translation: （The son of an elder saw the Buddha and sought the conditions for a long life.

source_sentence: 昔佛在世，有一長者子，年五六歲。
translation: Once upon a time, when the Buddha was alive, there was an elderly man named Son who was five or six years old.

source_sentence: 相師占之，福德具足，唯有短壽命。
translation: He was told by a fortune teller that he had an abundance of virtue but only a short life span.

source_sentence: 將至外道六師所，望求長壽，瞋彼六師都無有能與長壽法。
translation: He would go to six masters from another religion and hope to have a long life, but he was angry with them all for not being able to give him the teaching of longevity.

source_sentence: 將至佛所，白佛言：「此子短壽，唯願世尊與其長壽。」
translation: He went to the Buddha and said, "This son has a short life span; I wish the Bhagavān would grant him a long life."

source_sentence: 佛言：「無有是法能與長壽。」
translation: The Buddha said, "There's no such thing that can give him a long life."

source_sentence: 重白佛言：「願示方便。」
translation: Again, he said to the Buddha, "May it be shown to him skillfully."

source_sentence: 佛時教言：「汝到城門下，見人出者，為之作禮，入者亦禮。」
translation: The Buddha then taught, "Go down to the city gate and salute anyone who comes out, and salute anyone who enters."

source_sentence: 時有一鬼神，化作婆羅門身，欲來入城，小兒向禮，鬼呪願言：「使汝長壽。」
translation: A demon then, disguised as a brāhmaṇa, wanted to enter the city, and a young child paid homage to it.

source_sentence: 此鬼乃是殺小兒鬼，但鬼神之法，不得二語，以許長壽，更不得殺。
translation: This ghost is a child-killing ghost, but the rules for ghosts and spirits don't allow duplicity, and in order to grant a long life, they mustn't kill anyone.

source_sentence: 以其如是謙忍恭敬，得延壽命。
translation: Because it's thus humble, patient, and respectful, it will have a longer life.

source_sentence: （四八）◎長者子客作設會獲現報緣
translation: (48) Śrīgarbha's son will create a meeting to obtain the conditions for present retribution.

source_sentence: 昔佛在世時，有長者子，早喪父母，孤窮伶俜，客作自活。
translation: Once upon a time, when the Buddha was alive, there was an elderly man who lost his parents early, was lonely and destitute, and was living as a guest.

source_sentence: 聞有人說忉利天上，極為快樂，又聞他說供養佛僧，必得往生，即問他言：「用幾許物，可得供佛及以眾僧？」
translation: When he heard someone say that the heaven of the Thirty-three is extremely happy and that making offerings to the Buddha and saṃgha would surely lead to rebirth, he asked them, "With how many things can I make offerings to the Buddha and the saṃgha?"

source_sentence: 時人語言：「用三十兩金，可得作會。」
translation: The people there said, "For thirty taels of gold, you can make a meeting."

source_sentence: 便來向市，求客作處。
translation: He then went to the market and asked for a place to hire a guest to work.

source_sentence: 市邊有一大富長者，雇其客作，長者問言：「汝今能作何事？」
translation: There was a large, wealthy man at the edge of the market who hired a customer to do the job, and the man asked, "What can you do now?"

source_sentence: 答言：「是作皆能。」
translation: He replied, "These are all the works that can be done."

source_sentence: 「三年客作，索幾許物？」
translation: "How many things does a customer ask for in three years of work?"

source_sentence: 答言：「索三十兩金。」
translation: He replied, "I'll ask for thirty taels of gold."

source_sentence: 長者聞其事事皆能，即雇使作。
translation: The elder heard that he was capable of doing everything, so he hired him to do it.

source_sentence: 為人端直，金銀銅鐵，種種肆上，得利倍常。
translation: He was a straightforward man who made gold, silver, bronze, and iron, and received twice as much profit as usual.

source_sentence: 日月以滿，從彼長者，索作價金。
translation: When the sun and moon were up, he asked that man for a price of gold.

source_sentence: 長者問言：「汝今得金，用作何事？」
translation: The elder asked, "What will you do with the gold you've got now?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我欲供養佛僧。」
translation: He replied, "I want to make offerings to the Buddha and the saṃgha."

source_sentence: 長者語言：「我今佐汝，及以種種瓫器米麵，與汝作食，汝但請佛及以眾僧。」
translation: The elder said, "Now, I'll help you and give you various jars of rice and flour to eat, so you can invite the Buddha and the saṃgha."

source_sentence: 即詣僧房，請佛及僧。
translation: He went to the monk's quarters and invited the Buddha and the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 佛使眾僧皆受其請，佛住自房，眾僧皆受彼長者子請。
translation: The Buddha caused all the monks to accept his invitation, and the Buddha stayed in his own room while the monks accepted the invitation of the elder's son.

source_sentence: 正值節日，眾人皆送種種飲食，往與眾僧。
translation: On the occasion of a festival, the people brought various kinds of food and drink to the monks.

source_sentence: 眾僧食飽，到長者舍。
translation: After they had eaten their fill, the monks went to the house of the householder.

source_sentence: 時長者子，手自行食，上座言：「少著。」
translation: The elder's son then helped himself to food, and the superior monk said, "Don't get attached."

source_sentence: 次第皆言少著，至訖下行。
translation: Each in turn said, 'Don't be too attached,' and they went downstairs after finishing their meal.

source_sentence: 時長者子，啼哭懊惱，「辛苦三年，設此飲食，望眾僧食；僧不為食，我求生天，必不得生。」
translation: The elder's son then lamented and was distressed, "I've worked hard for three years to build this meal in the hope that the saṃgha will eat it; if the saṃgha doesn't serve it, I won't be born in heaven if I try to be born there."

source_sentence: 往至佛邊，白佛言：「眾僧不食我供，而我所願，必當不得。」
translation: He went to the Buddha and said, "The saṃgha won't eat my offerings, and what I wish for will surely not be possible."

source_sentence: 佛言：「少食以不？」
translation: The Buddha said, "Would you like to eat a little?"

source_sentence: 答言：「皆悉少食。」
translation: He replied, "They all eat a little."

source_sentence: 佛言：「假使不食汝願必成，況復少食而不成也？」
translation: The Buddha said, "Suppose you didn't eat and your vow would be fulfilled, how could you not eat a little and it wouldn't be fulfilled?"

source_sentence: 童子歡喜，還來飲食。
translation: Rejoicing, the boy returned to eat.

source_sentence: 彼時眾僧食訖即還。
translation: The monks then returned after they had eaten.

source_sentence: 時有五百賈客，入海來還，入城募索飲食。
translation: Five hundred merchants then returned from their journey to the sea and entered the city to solicit food and drink.

source_sentence: 時世飢饉，無有與者。
translation: The world was starving, and there was no one to give it to.

source_sentence: 有人語言：「彼長者子，今日設會，必有飲食。」
translation: Someone said, "That prince has set up a meeting today, and there will be food and drink."

source_sentence: 時長者子，聞有賈客，歡喜與食，五百賈客，皆得充足，一切將從，悉亦飽滿。
translation: When the eldest son heard about the visitors, he was delighted to give them food, and all 500 of them were supplied with enough, and all those who were about to follow were also fed.

source_sentence: 最下賈客，解一珠與，直萬兩金；最上頭者，解一珠與，直十萬兩金。
translation: The lowest paying customer gave him a pearl amounting to 10,000 taels of gold, and the highest paying customer gave him a pearl amounting to 100,000 taels of gold.

source_sentence: 五百賈客，人與一珠，與一銅盔，與此長者子，而不敢取。
translation: Five hundred merchants each gave a pearl and a bronze helmet to this elder's son, but they didn't dare to take them.

source_sentence: 往走問佛，佛言：「此是華報，但取無苦，後必生天，不足恐懼。」
translation: They went and asked the Buddha, who said, "This is the reward of flowers; if you take it, there's no suffering; you'll be born in the heavens later, so there's nothing to fear."

source_sentence: 主人長者，更無男兒，唯有一女，即與童子。
translation: The man who owned the house had no sons but a daughter, who he then gave to the boy.

source_sentence: 如是家業，遂大熾盛，舍衛城中，最為第一。
translation: Thus, his family's business became so prosperous that it was the best in the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 長者命終，波斯匿王，聞其聰明智見，以其家業，悉乞與之。
translation: When the elder's life ended, King Prasenajit heard of his wisdom and vision and asked him to give his family's business to all of them.

source_sentence: 華報如是，其果在後。
translation: Thus were the rewards of flowers, and their results followed.

source_sentence: （四九）◎弗那施佛鉢食獲現報緣
translation: (49) -Prajñā gave the Buddha a bowl of food to obtain the present rewards.

source_sentence: 昔佛在世，有梵志兄弟五人，一名耶奢。
translation: Once upon a time, when the Buddha was alive, there were five priest brothers, one Yeshe.

source_sentence: 二名無垢，三名憍梵波提，四名蘇馱夷；四兄入山學道，得五神通。
translation: Two were called Vimalakīrti, three were Kauṇḍinya Bodhisattva, and four were called Sudarśana; these four brothers went into the mountains to train on the path and attained the five supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 其最小弟，名曰弗那，見佛乞食，盛好白淨飯，滿鉢施佛。
translation: The youngest brother, named Pūrṇa, saw the Buddha begging for food, filled his bowl with good, pure rice, and gave it to him.

source_sentence: 爾時弗那，恒以耕種為業，時耕種訖，還歸于家。
translation: At the time, Pūrṇa had always cultivated the land as his occupation, and when he finished cultivating, he returned home.

source_sentence: 後於一日，出到田中，見其田中，所生苗稼，變成金禾，皆長數尺，收刈已盡，還生如初。
translation: One day, he went out to his fields and saw that the crops growing there had turned into golden sheaves, each several feet long, and that after they were harvested and mowed, they had grown back as before.

source_sentence: 國王聞之，亦來收刈，不能得盡，如是一切，諸來取者，皆不能盡。
translation: When the king heard about it, he also came to harvest it, but he couldn't get it all, and so did all the people who came to take it.

source_sentence: 兄等念言：「我弟弗那，為得生活，為貧苦耶？」
translation: The brothers thought, "Did my brother Pūrṇa attain a living, or was he poor?"

source_sentence: 尋共來看，見弟福業踰於國王，便語弟言：「汝先貧窮，云何卒富？」
translation: When he looked into the situation and saw that his younger brother's fortune exceeded that of the king, he said to his younger brother, "You were poor; how did you become rich?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我見瞿曇，施一鉢飯，得如是報。」
translation: They replied, "I saw the Gautama and gave him a bowl of rice, and this was the result."

source_sentence: 四兄聞已，歡喜踊躍，又語弟言：「爾今為我，作歡喜團，我等四人，各持一團，供養瞿曇，願求生天，不聽其法，不用解脫。」
translation: After hearing this, the four brothers rejoiced and jumped for joy. They also said to their younger brother, "Now, let's make a bundle of joy for me. Four of us will each take a bundle and offer it to the Gautama, hoping to be born in heaven, not hearing his teaching, and not needing to be liberated."

source_sentence: 於是各擔歡喜團，往至佛所，大兄捉一團，著佛鉢中，佛言：「諸行無常。」
translation: Each of us then carried a ball of joy to the Buddha, and the eldest brother grabbed a ball and put it in his bowl.

source_sentence: 第二復以歡喜團，著佛鉢中，佛作是語：「是生滅法。」
translation: Second, he put a ball of joy in the Buddha's bowl, and the Buddha said, "These are the dharmas of arising and ceasing."

source_sentence: 第三復以歡喜之團，著佛鉢裏，佛作是語：「生滅滅已。」
translation: Third, he put a ball of joy in the Buddha's bowl, and the Buddha said, "Birth ceases to exist."

source_sentence: 第四復以歡喜之團，著佛鉢中，佛作是語：「寂滅為樂。」
translation: Fourth, he put a bundle of joy in the Buddha's bowl, and the Buddha made this statement, "Tranquility is bliss."

source_sentence: 即還歸家，至寂靜處，共相問言：「汝聞何語？」
translation: They returned home and went to a quiet place, where they asked each other, "What words have you heard?"

source_sentence: 第一兄言：「我聞諸行無常。」
translation: The first brother says, "I've heard that all conditioned things are impermanent."

source_sentence: 次者復聞是生滅法，又次者聞生滅滅已，第四者聞寂滅為樂。
translation: The next one also hears that these things arise and cease, and the next one hears that birth and cessation cease, and the fourth one hears that tranquility is bliss.

source_sentence: 兄弟四人，各思此偈，得阿那含，皆來佛所，求為出家，得阿羅漢道。
translation: Each of the four brothers considered this verse, became non-returners, came to the Buddha, sought to leave home, and attained the arhat path.

source_sentence: （五〇）大愛道施佛金縷織成衣并穿珠師緣
translation: (50) The Great Way of Love Gives the Buddha a Gold Woven Robe and a Jeweled Master's Ritual

source_sentence: 昔佛在世，大愛道為佛作金縷織成衣，齎來上佛，佛即語言：「用施眾僧。」
translation: Once, when the Buddha was alive, the great beloved Way made a gold woven robe for the Buddha and brought it to him, and he said, "Give it to the saṃgha."

source_sentence: 大愛道言：「我以乳餔長養世尊，自作此衣，故來奉佛，必望如來為我受之。
translation: The great beloved way said, "I raised the Bhagavān with milk and food and made this robe myself, so I came to present it to the Buddha and surely hope the Tathāgata will accept it for me.

source_sentence: 云何方言與眾僧也？」
translation: How did you say it would be given to the saṃgha?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「欲使姨母得大功德。
translation: The Buddha said, "I want my aunt to attain great merit.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 眾僧福田，廣大無邊，是故勸爾。
translation: The field of merit of the saṃgha is vast and limitless; therefore, I encourage you to do so.

source_sentence: 若隨我語，已供養佛。」
translation: If you follow my words, you'll have made offerings to the Buddha."

source_sentence: 時大愛道，即持此衣，往到僧中，從上座行，無敢取者。
translation: The great lover of the Way then took this robe and went to the saṃgha and followed the superior seat, daring no one to take it.

source_sentence: 次到彌勒，彌勒受衣，即著入城乞食。
translation: Next, he went to Maitreya, who accepted the robe and put it on as he entered the city to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 彌勒身有三十二相，紫磨金色，既到城裏，眾人競看，無與食者。
translation: Maitreya's body had thirty-two marks and was purple and gold in color. When he arrived in the city, the people competed to see him, but there was no one to give him food.

source_sentence: 有一穿珠師，見諸人等無與食者，即前跪請，將至家中，與彌勒食。
translation: When a bead piercer saw that there was no one to feed him, he knelt down and asked him to come home and give Maitreya a meal.

source_sentence: 彌勒食訖，時穿珠師，以一小座，敷彌勒前，求欲聽法。
translation: When Maitreya had finished eating, the pearl piercer put a small seat in front of Maitreya and asked him to listen to the teaching.

source_sentence: 彌勒有四辯才力，即便為說種種妙法。
translation: Maitreya had the power of four kinds of eloquence, and he explained the various wonderful teachings for him.

source_sentence: 時穿珠師，願樂聽聞，無有厭足。
translation: The pearl-bearer then was willing to listen and had no trouble at all.

source_sentence: 先有長者，將欲嫁女，雇穿珠師，穿一寶珠，與錢十萬。
translation: An elderly man who was about to marry his daughter hired a pearl piercer to pierce a precious pearl and give him 100,000 coins.

source_sentence: 當此之時，彼嫁女家，遣人索珠。
translation: At the time, the bride-to-be's family sent someone to ask for the pearl.

source_sentence: 時穿珠師，聽法情濃，不暇為穿，即答之言：「且可小待須臾之頃。」
translation: The bead piercer, hearing that he was too impassioned by the teaching to pierce it, replied, "Perhaps you could wait a little while longer."

source_sentence: 已復來索，乃至三返猶故不得。
translation: He then came back and asked for it three times, but he still couldn't get it.

source_sentence: 彼長者瞋，合其珠錢還來奪去。
translation: The elder was angry, so he returned with the money for the pearls and took it away.

source_sentence: 穿珠師婦，瞋其夫言：「更無業也，須臾穿珠，得十萬利，云何聽此道人美說？」
translation: The pearl-piercing master and his wife were angry with their husband, saying, "How could they have listened to the beautiful words of this man of the Way when they had no business piercing the pearls in a moment and had gained 100,000 li?"

source_sentence: 其夫聞已，意中恨恨。
translation: After hearing this, his husband's thoughts were hostile.

source_sentence: 爾時彌勒，知其恨恨，即問之言：「汝能隨我，至寺以不？」
translation: Knowing his resentment, Maitreya then asked him, "Will you follow me to the temple?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我能。」
translation: He replied, "I can."

source_sentence: 即隨彌勒，往僧坊中，問上座言：「有人得金滿十萬斤，何如歡喜聽人說法？」
translation: He followed Maitreya into the monastery and asked the superior seat, "How would someone who has a hundred thousand pounds of gold rejoice to hear someone preach?"

source_sentence: 憍陳如言：「假使有人得金十萬，不如有人以一鉢食施持戒者，況能信心須臾聽法，復勝於彼百千萬倍。」
translation: Kauṇḍinya said, "Suppose someone were to obtain 100,000 pieces of gold, but it's not as good as someone who gives the precepts with a single bowl of food, how much more so if they can have faith and listen to the teaching for a moment, which is a hundred million times better than that?"

source_sentence: 於是又問第二上座，上座答言：「設復有人得十萬車金，亦不如以一鉢之食施持戒者，況復聽法歡喜，經於時節。」
translation: He then asked the second councilor, who replied, "Even if someone were to obtain 100,000 carts of gold, it wouldn't be as good as someone who gives the precepts with a single bowl of food, so how could they listen to the teaching and rejoice for a while?"

source_sentence: 又復問於第三上座，上座答言：「若有人得十萬舍金，亦復不如施持戒人一鉢之食，況復聽法？」
translation: Again, he asked the third councilor, who replied, "Suppose someone were to obtain 100,000 shekels of gold, but it wouldn't be as good as giving one bowl of food to a person who upholds the precepts, so how could they listen to the teaching?"

source_sentence: 又問第四上座，上座答言：「若其有得十萬國金，亦復不如施持戒人一鉢之食，況復聽法，百千萬倍。」
translation: He also asked the fourth councilor, who replied, "Even if someone were to attain 100,000 pieces of gold, it wouldn't be as good as giving a single bowl of food to a person who upholds the precepts, so why wouldn't they listen to the teaching a million times over?"

source_sentence: 如是次問乃至阿那律，阿那律言：「有人得滿四天下金，猶故不如施持戒人一鉢之食，況復聽法？」
translation: Aniruddha then asked even Aniruddha, who said, "Even if someone were to attain a total of four worlds' worth of gold, it wouldn't be as good as giving a monk who upholds the precepts a bowl of food, so how could he listen to the teaching?"

source_sentence: 彌勒答言：「尊者說言有施比丘一鉢之食，乃至勝得滿四天下金，云何如是？」
translation: Maitreya answered, "Venerable sir, you said that there are monks who give a bowl of food up to the amount of gold that fills the four heavens, how is it?"

source_sentence: 尊者答言：「以自身為證，憶念往昔九十億劫，有一長者，有其二子，一名利吒，二名阿利吒，恒告之言：『高者亦墮，常者亦盡，夫生有死，合會有離。』
translation: The Venerable replied, "Taking myself as witness, I recall a time nine billion eons in the past when an elderly man with two sons, one named Reza and the other named Ariṣṭa, always told him, 'The high will fall, the permanent will end, birth will have death, and union will have separation.'

source_sentence: 長者得病，臨命終時，約勅兒子：『慎莫分居。
translation: When the elder became ill and was about to die, he promised his sons, 'Don't be careful about living apart.

source_sentence: 譬如一絲不能繫象，多集諸絲，象不能絕。
translation: It's like a single thread that can't bind an elephant, but when many threads are gathered, the elephant can't be cut off.

source_sentence: 兄弟並立，亦如多絲。』
translation: When brothers are standing together, it's likewise like many threads.'

source_sentence: 時彼長者，囑誡子竟，氣絕命終。
translation: After he had instructed his son, the elder's breath gave out and his life ended.

source_sentence: 以父勅故，兄弟共活，極相敬念。
translation: Because of his father's command, the brothers lived together and held great respect for each other.

source_sentence: 後為弟娶婦，生活未幾，而此弟婦語其夫言：『汝如彼奴。
translation: Later, he married his younger brother, and not long afterward, this younger brother's wife said to her husband, 'You're like that slave.'

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 錢財用度，應當人客，皆由汝兄，汝今唯得衣食而已，非奴如何？』
translation: Your money, property, and necessities should be used by human guests, and they all belong to your brother.

source_sentence: 數作此語。
translation: They often made these remarks.

source_sentence: 爾時夫婦，心生變異，求兄分居。
translation: At the time, the couple had a change of heart and asked their brother to separate them.

source_sentence: 兄語弟言：『汝不憶父臨終之言？』
translation: The brother said to the younger brother, 'Don't you remember what your father said at the end of his life?'

source_sentence: 猶不自改，數求分居。
translation: Still, he didn't change his ways and repeatedly asked to be separated from his family.

source_sentence: 兄見弟意，正便與分居，一切所有，皆中半分。
translation: Seeing my brother's intention, he agreed to a separation, giving him half of everything he owned.

source_sentence: 弟之夫婦，年少遊逸，用度奢侈，未經幾時，貧窮困匱，來從兄乞。
translation: My brother's wife, a young woman, had wandered about and spent lavishly.

source_sentence: 其兄爾時，與錢十萬，得去未久，以復用盡，而更來索。
translation: At the time, his brother gave him 100,000 pieces of money, which he had left not long before he used it up again and came back to ask for more.

source_sentence: 如是六返，皆與十萬。
translation: He returned six times like this and was given 100,000.

source_sentence: 至第七返，兄便責數：『汝不念父臨終之言，求於分異，不能乃心生活，數來索物；今更與汝十萬之錢，從今已往，不好生活，重復來索，更不與汝。』
translation: When he came back the seventh time, his brother rebuked him, saying, 'You didn't remember what your father had said at the end of your life, and you asked for more things because you wanted to live differently and couldn't be bothered to ask for more; now, I've given you another 100,000 pieces of money, but from now on, I won't be able to live well, so I'll ask for it again, and I won't give it to you.'

source_sentence: 得是苦語，夫婦二人，用心生活，以漸得富。
translation: After hearing these bitter words, the couple lived their lives with care and gradually became rich.

source_sentence: 兄錢財喪失，以漸貧窮，來從弟乞，其弟乃至不讓兄食，而作是言：『謂兄常富，亦復貧耶？
translation: When their brother lost his money and possessions and grew poor, he begged from his brother, who wouldn't even let him eat and said, 'Suppose your brother is always rich and yet he's still poor?'

source_sentence: 我昔從汝，有所乞索，苦切見責，今日何故，來從我索？』
translation: I've asked for something from you in the past, and I've been pained and rebuked for it; why have you come to ask for it from me today?'

source_sentence: 兄聞此已，極生憂惱，自作念言：『同生兄弟，猶尚如此，況於外人？』
translation: After hearing this, his brother became extremely distressed and thought to himself, 'How could it be that brothers who are born together are still like this, let alone outsiders?'

source_sentence: 厭惡生死，遂不還家，入山學道，精懃苦行，得辟支佛。
translation: Disillusioned with birth and death, he didn't return home, went to the mountains to train on the path, and after intense hard work and practice, attained Pārśva.

source_sentence: 其弟後亦以漸貧窮，遭世飢饉，賣薪自活。
translation: Later, his disciple also grew poor, suffered from worldly hunger, and sold firewood to support himself.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛，入城乞食，竟無所得，空鉢還出。
translation: At the time, the Vaiśravaṇa went into the city to solicit alms, but after getting nothing, he returned with his empty bowl.

source_sentence: 時賣薪人，見辟支佛空鉢出城，即以賣薪所得稗麨，而欲與之，語辟支佛言：『尊者能食麤惡食不？』
translation: When the firewood vendor saw Pārśva leave town with his empty bowl, he offered to give him some bread and butter from his firewood sale and said to Pārśva, 'Venerable, can you eat coarse food?'

source_sentence: 答言：『不問好惡，趣得支身。』
translation: He replied, 'I don't ask about good or evil, but I'm headed for a part of the body.'

source_sentence: 時賣薪人，即便授與。
translation: The firewood vendor then gave it to him.

source_sentence: 辟支佛受而食之，食訖之後，飛騰虛空，作十八變，即還所止。
translation: After he finished eating, he soared into the sky, underwent 18 transformations, and returned to his lodging.

source_sentence: 時賣薪人，後更取薪，道見一兔，以杖撩之，變成死人，卒起而來，抱取薪人項，彼取薪人，種種方便，欲推令去，不能得離，脫衣雇人，使挽却之，亦不得離；展轉至闇，負來向家，既到家中，死人自解，墮在於地，作真金人。
translation: The firewood seller then went back to get firewood and saw a rabbit that he had picked up with his staff and turned into a dead man.

source_sentence: 時賣薪人，即便截却金人之頭，頭尋還生，却其手脚，手脚還生，須臾之間，金頭金手滿其屋裏，積為大[卄/積]。
translation: The firewood vendor then even cut off the head of the gold figure, which was then returned to life, and cut off his hands and feet, which were then returned to life, and in a moment the gold head and hands filled his house with gold, making a large [twenty/calendar] pile.

source_sentence: 隣比告官：『此貧窮人，屋裏自然有此金[卄/積]。』
translation: The neighboring monks told the officer, 'This poor man's house naturally contains this gold [twenty/gallons].'

source_sentence: 王聞遣使，往覆撿之。
translation: When the king heard about it, he sent an envoy to inspect it.

source_sentence: 即到屋裏，純見爛臭死人手頭。
translation: When he arrived, he saw a rotten, smelly, dead man's head inside his house.

source_sentence: 其人自捉金頭，來以上王，便是真金。
translation: That man grabbed his own gold head and gave it to the king, saying it was real gold.

source_sentence: 王大歡喜：『此是福人。』
translation: The king was overjoyed, 'This is a fortunate man.'

source_sentence: 即封聚落。
translation: He then sealed the village.

source_sentence: 從是命終，生第二天，為天帝釋，下生人中，為轉輪聖王，天王人王，九十一劫，不曾斷絕。
translation: After his life ended, he was born on the second day as the god Indra and went down to live among men as a wheel-turning sage king, king of gods and men, for 91 eons without ever being cut off.

source_sentence: 今最後身，生於釋種，初生之日，四十里中，伏藏珍寶，自然踊出。
translation: Now, in his final lifetime, he's born into the Śākya lineage, and on the day he was first born, hidden treasures sprang up naturally in a forty-mile radius.

source_sentence: 後漸長大，兄釋摩男，父母偏愛，阿那律母，欲試諸兒，時遣語無食。
translation: When he grew up, his older brother, Śāmāyana, was loved by his parents, and Aniruddha's mother wanted to test her children, but she told him she had nothing to eat.

source_sentence: 阿那律言：『但擔無食來。』
translation: Aniruddha said, 'Just bring them a bowl of food.'

source_sentence: 即與空器，時空器中，百味飯食，自然盈滿。
translation: He then gave them an empty vessel, and in that empty vessel there was a hundred flavors of food that naturally filled it to overflowing.

source_sentence: 設以四天下金，用為乳哺，不足一劫，況九十一劫，常受快樂。
translation: Suppose we were to take gold from the four heavens and use it to nurse our children for less than an eon, but it would be 91 eons of constant pleasure.

source_sentence: 所以我今得此自然飲食，適由先身施此一鉢之食，今得此報，上至諸佛，下至梵天，淨持戒者，皆名持戒。」
translation: That's why I've now attained this natural diet, thanks to my predecessor's gift of this one bowl of food, and now I've attained this reward, which will reward everyone up to the buddhas and down to the brahma heavens, who are pure adherents of the precepts."

source_sentence: 時穿珠師，聞是語已，心大歡喜。
translation: After hearing these words, the bead piercer was greatly encouraged.

source_sentence: ◎雜寶藏經卷第四
translation: Śrīmālā-sūtra, Vol. 4
